The place can become a bit crowded, especially around the lunch time.

Good shopping centre with a lot of larger stores, a decent enough food court above and a really big supermarket on the ground floor.

I often stay up in Brevnov, but normally make my way down here each trip to stock up on supplies and see what's useful. The iWant store generally has the tech thing I've forgotten to bring and Tesco for some snacks and drinks at a decent price. Under Armour here sometimes has what is sold out in the UK. And it's close enough to the bus stop for the trip to the airport.

question: Review comment
answer:
A decent shopping mall with hours that I found to be quite convenient; open until 8 PM, except for Carrefour which extends its hours until 10 PM.

The also mall opens its doors early to accommodate the needs of the local residents who need to pass through on their way to work, providing access to the Cr√©teil - Pr√©fecture m√©tro station. (You need not detour this whole structure to reach the station as Google maps may incorrectly suggest.)

I observed that the mall is clean, relatively new, and contributes positively to the quality of life for nearby residents.

During my visit in June 2023 I also discovered that the mall offers a variety of food options (over 40 restaurants), particularly fast food which caters to commuters, busy individuals, and those who prefer not to cook.

It's a fascinating blend of Urbania and Paris, reflecting the urban lifestyle.

I like this place. Top marks. If I find myself in Cr√©teil again, I will certainly make a return visit. Merci!
